name: film_actor
summary: A junction table linking actors to films.
purpose: To manage the many-to-many relationship between actors and films. It allows a single actor to participate in multiple films and a single film to feature multiple actors, without duplicating actor or film data.
dependencies_thoughts: Relates to the `actor` table (actor_id to actor_id) and the `film` table (film_id to film_id). Records here depend on the existence of IDs in both parent tables, with restrictive delete behavior and cascading updates.

columns.description: The numerical identifier of the actor. This is part of the composite primary key and a foreign key referencing the 'actor' table.
The numerical identifier of the film. This is part of the composite primary key and a foreign key referencing the 'film' table.
A timestamp indicating when the record was last updated, defaulting to the current time. Useful for auditing or tracking changes.
